PUBLICATIONS AND LAW CASES (Boxes 110-119)(See boxes 118 and 119 for works by Bell)
Derrick Bell Published articles in Journals 1956-1993 (bound and un-bound)

-Annual Orientation Program for Black Law Students, Sept 8, 1973, "Law School Exams & Minority-Group Students: The Problem & Some Suggested Solutions" -Freedomways, Vol 13, No. 4, 1973, "NAACP: Faith and Opportunity" (2) - "Racism in American Courts: Cause for Black Disruption or Despair?" from California Law Review, Jan 1973 (3) -California Law Review, Vol. 61, No. 1 Jan 1973 "Racism in American Courts: Cause for Black Disruption or Despair?" (2) -The Road Ahead, 1973 (NAACP) "Remedies for Employment Discrimination" - Book Review of The Case for Black Reparations by Prof. Boris I. Bittker, from Harvard Civil Rights - Civil - "The Real Cost of Racial Equality" from Civil Liberties Review, Survey, Summer 1974 (3)-Law and Contemporary Problems, Vol. 39, No. 1, Winter 1975, "Waiting on the Promise of Brown" -Law and Contemporary Problems, Vol. 39, No. 2, Spring 1975, "Waiting on the Promise of Brown" (3) - "Waiting on the Promise of Brown" from Law and Contemporary Problems, Spring 1975 (3) -Journal of Law & Education, Vol. 4, No. 1, Jan 1975, "A Special Commentary on the Detroit Met Desegregation Decision" (3) -N. Carolina Central Law Journal, Vol. 7, No 1, Fall 1975 "The Burden of Brown on Blacks: History-Based Observations on a Landmark Decision" (2) - "The Burden of Brown on Blacks: History-Based Observations on a Landmark Decision," from N. Carolina -Emory Law Journal, Vol 25, No. 4, Fall 1976, "Book Review: "Affirmation Discrimination: Ethnic Inequality & Public Policy" by Nathan Glazer -The Yale Law Journal, Vol 85 No. 4, March 1976 "Serving Two Masters: Integration Ideals & Client Interests in School Desegregation Litigation" (2) -Notre Dame Lawyer, Vol 52, No. 1, Oct. 1976, "Racial Remediation: An Historical Perspective on Current Conditions" - Book Review: "Justice Accused: Antislavery and the Judicial Process," from Columbia Law Review, March 1976 (3) - "Is Brown obsolete? Yes!" from Integrateducation, May-June, 1976
